resources.string: There was an error initializing the YouTubePlayer (%1$s)
Thank you for using the 7 Minute Workout application.

I hope this application helps you achieve your fitness goals by providing you with simple and clear instructions on how to do the 7 Minute Workout. Remember to always check with your doctor before exercising and seek professional help to ensure correct form of the exercises.
The workout videos from Youtube remain the owner\'s, please support them because they do amazing work making them available.
Q. Who invented the 7 Minute Workout?
A. It was developed by scientists at McMaster University in Hamilton, Onatrio. You can read more here.
Q. What is the 7 Minute Workout?
A. The 7 Minute Workout consists of 12 high intensity body weight exercises. 30 seconds per exercise. 10 seconds rest between exercises.
Q. What equipment do I need for the workouts?
A. You only need yourself, a chair, and a wall to do the workout.
Q. I found an issue with the app or have a general question, what do I do?
A. Please send me an email with details to 7minuteworkout@michaelcarrano.com
This application requires the Internet permission to function correctly. The Internet permission is used for the following third party services used in the application:
1. Youtube (Youtube app also required in order to play workout videos)
2. Crashlytics (Collects device data to help identify the cause of a crash)
3. Google Analytics (Collects data on how users are using the application)
In addition, this app is open sourced on Github.

Start with your feet together and arms at your sides. Slightly bend your knees and jump straight up. As you are jumping kick your legs out to shoulder width and bring your hands over your head to form a "star".
Stand straight with your back against the wall with your legs shoulder width apart and a little away from the wall. Lower your hips until your legs are at right angles and then stand back up.

Lay flat on your stomach with your palms flat on the floor approximately shoulder width apart. Push up on your hands until your arms are straight. Lower yourself until your arms are at 90-degrees. Repeat.
A crunch begins with lying face up on the floor with knees bent. The movement begins by curling the shoulders towards the pelvis. The hands can be behind or beside the neck or crossed over the chest.
Stand in front of the step, with your feet about shoulder width apart. Step up onto the step with one foot, followed by the other. Pause and then step off with the opposite foot. Repeat.

Stand with your feet slightly wider than your hips and your toes pointed slightly out. Keeping your back straight lower your hips and bend your knees until you are parallel with the floor. Reverse until you are back in the original standing position.

Sit with the heels of your hands on the edge of a sturdy chair seat. Slide your bottom off the seat, and support your weight with your hands. Bend your elbows back, and slowly lower your butt toward the floor while keeping your elbows tucked in.

Lay on your stomach and bend your elbows 90-degrees and rest your weight on your forearms. Your elbows should be directly beneath your shoulders, and your body should form a straight line from your head to your feet. Hold the position.
Run on the spot lifting your knees as high as possible, swing your arms as if you were running normally.

Keep your upper body straight, with your shoulders back and relaxed and chin up. Step forward with one leg, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at about a 90-degree angle. Keep the weight in your heels as you push back up to the starting position.

Perform a push-up, at top rotate the body into side-plank position with one arm on ground and other extended toward ceiling. Rotate back to top of push-up position. Perform push-up and repeat rotation to opposite side.

Lay on your stomach and bend your elbows 90-degrees and rest your weight on your forearms (or hand if you prefer). Your elbows should be directly beneath your shoulders. Rotate 90-degrees so all your weight in on one forearm. Hold the position.
